    • Constructor Detail

      • Location

        public Location(java.lang.String state,
                java.lang.String city)
        Location is a set of demographic and place information.
        Parameters:
        state - The full name of the state. e.g. "Ohio" and not an abbreviation.
        city - The full name of the city. e.g. "Columbus" or null for an entire state.

    • Method Detail

      • getZipCode

        public java.lang.String getZipCode(java.lang.String cityName,
                                   RandomNumberGenerator random)
        Get the zip code for the given city name. If a city has more than one zip code, this picks a random one.
        Parameters:
        cityName - Name of the city
        random - Used for a source of repeatable randomness when selecting a zipcode when multiple exist for a location
        Returns:
        a zip code for the given city

      • getZipCodes

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getZipCodes(java.lang.String cityName)
        Get the list of zip codes (or postal codes) by city name.
        Parameters:
        cityName - Name of the city.
        Returns:
        List of legal zip codes or postal codes.

      • getPopulation

        public long getPopulation(java.lang.String cityName)

      • randomCity

        public Demographics randomCity(RandomNumberGenerator random)
        Pick the name of a random city from the current "world". If only one city was selected, this will return that one city.
        Parameters:
        random - The source of randomness.
        Returns:
        Demographics of a random city.

      • randomCity

        Returns:

      • randomCityName

        public java.lang.String randomCityName(RandomNumberGenerator random)
        Pick a random city name, weighted by population.
        Parameters:
        random - the source of randomness
        Returns:
        a city name

      • randomBirthPlace

        public java.lang.String[] randomBirthPlace(RandomNumberGenerator random)
        Pick a random birth place, weighted by population.
        Parameters:
        random - the source of randomness
        Returns:
        Array of Strings: [city, state, country, "city, state, country"]

      • randomBirthplaceByLanguage

        public java.lang.String[] randomBirthplaceByLanguage(RandomNumberGenerator random,
                                                     java.lang.String language)
        Method which returns a city from the foreignPlacesOfBirth map if the map contains values for an language. In the case an language is not present the method returns the value from a call to randomCityName().
        Parameters:
        random - the source of randomness
        language - the language to look for cities in
        Returns:
        A String representing the place of birth

      • assignPoint

        public void assignPoint(Person person,
                        java.lang.String cityName)
        Assign a geographic location to the given Person. Location includes City, State, Zip, and Coordinate. If cityName is given, then Zip and Coordinate are restricted to valid values for that city. If cityName is not given, then picks a random city from the list of all cities.
        Parameters:
        person - Person to assign location information
        cityName - Name of the city, or null to choose one randomly

      • assignPoint

        public void assignPoint(Clinician clinician,
                        java.lang.String cityName)
        Assign a geographic location to the given Clinician. Location includes City, State, Zip, and Coordinate. If cityName is given, then Zip and Coordinate are restricted to valid values for that city. If cityName is not given, then picks a random city from the list of all cities.
        Parameters:
        clinician - Clinician to assign location information
        cityName - Name of the city, or null to choose one randomly

      • setSocialDeterminants

        public void setSocialDeterminants(Person person)
        Set social determinants of health attributes on the patient, as defined by the optional social determinants of health county-level file.
        Parameters:
        person - The person to assign attributes.

      • getAbbreviation

        public static java.lang.String getAbbreviation(java.lang.String state)
        Get the abbreviation for a state.
        Parameters:
        state - State name. e.g. "Massachusetts"
        Returns:
        state abbreviation. e.g. "MA"

      • getIndex

        public static int getIndex(java.lang.String state)
        Get the index for a state. This maybe useful for exporters where you want to generate a list of unique identifiers that do not collide across state-boundaries.
        Parameters:
        state - State name. e.g. "Massachusetts"
        Returns:
        state index. e.g. 1 or 50

      • getStateName

        public static java.lang.String getStateName(java.lang.String abbreviation)
        Get the state name from an abbreviation.
        Parameters:
        abbreviation - State abbreviation. e.g. "MA"
        Returns:
        state name. e.g. "Massachusetts"

      • loadCitiesByLanguage

        protected static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> loadCitiesByLanguage(java.lang.String resource)
        Load a resource which contains foreign places of birth based on ethnicity in json format:

        {"ethnicity":["city1,state1,country1", "city2,state2,country2"..., "cityN,stateN,countryN"]}

        see src/main/resources/foreign_birthplace.json for a working example package protected for testing
        Parameters:
        resource - A json file listing foreign places of birth by ethnicity.
        Returns:
        Map of ethnicity to Lists of Strings "city,state,country"

      • getTimezoneByState

        public static java.lang.String getTimezoneByState(java.lang.String state)
        Get the full name of the timezone by the full name of the state. Timezones are approximate.
        Parameters:
        state - The full name of the state (e.g. "Massachusetts")
        Returns:
        The full name of the timezone (e.g. "Eastern Standard Time")
